Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer's analysis of the child's best interests was reasonable under s. 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Decision_Outcome: Refusal of inland permanent residence application based on H&C grounds
Legal_Rule: Under s. 25(1) IRPA, officers must consider the best interests of a child as a primary consideration when making H&C decisions
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate consideration of the child's best interests
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Case remitted for reconsideration by a different officer
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer's approach found unreasonable due to improper focus
Key_Evidence_Considered: Child's best interests, conditions in Brazil
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) provisions under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging refusal of permanent residence application
Legal_Rule_Source: Section 25(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Outcome: Remitted for reconsideration with instructions to properly assess the child's best interests
Claimant_Status: Applicants seeking permanent residence on H&C grounds
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Permanent residence application on H&C grounds
Governing_Rule: Best interests of the child as a primary consideration under s. 25(1) IRPA
